metadata.title: CVE-2023-32209 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A maliciously crafted favicon could have led to an out of memory crash.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 113.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 113.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 113.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 113.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '113.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
